p.s: My article is based on the germanGerman interview Fast Fashion: Unser Kleiderkonsum ist Wahnsinn which is about buying clothes and the story behind the clothes that we buy.

In the interview it is mentioned that one of the worst situations that he ever came across to the textile sector was the water source Buriganga in Bangladesh which is completely black and full with plastic because there are a lot of fabrics in the area and all of the trash, plastic that comes out of the fabrics flow straight into the water.
It is also mentioned that the workers that work in the textile fabrics of Bangladesh work for 10-12 hours a day which is a lot.
The people in China for example are happy and proud when they are able to produce 300 Boxershortsboxers per hour which is quite tragic because it means that they barely get any time to rest.
In the interview it is mentioned that protesting isn't a solution since that would make the people lose their jobs and income.
Instead we should try to help them by trying to make their work conditions better.
Lastly the politics have to change and start put more pressure on companies.
